name: (2E)-2-(hydroxyimino)-3-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl)propanoic acid
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-915
Reason: 2-hydroxyimino group can increase the melting point due to the presence of a hydrogen bonding potential, which can raise it by approximately +10°C. The 4-hydroxy-3-methoxyphenyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The propanoic acid group can also participate in hydrogen bonding, which can add approximately +10°C.
